p: As shown in Figure 5, the percentage of free radical inhibition of hydroethanolic extracts such as flavonoids, saponins, and mucilages was lower than that of ascorbic acid ( Figure 6). The antioxidant activity of the flavonoids fraction (IC 50 = 1.51 mg/ml) was more pronounced compared to the other hydroethanolic extracts (IC 50 = 1.628 mg/ml), saponins (IC 50 = 1.94 mg/ml), and mucilages (IC 50 = 9.674 mg/ml). The statistical analysis showed a significant difference between the IC 50 values of all tested extracts and that of the ascorbic acid (IC 50 = 0.23 mg/ml) ( p value <0.05).
